review_title: Great ABA organization to grow and learn!
pros: Small organization, family-like feel with leadership team knowing all of the employees, open-door policy-active encouragement of employees to bring ideas up for problem solving so that changes can be made. Great training program for new behavior technicians, which includes ongoing professional development and supervision. BCBA supervision is included in employment, is structured and includes the opportunity to learn behavior analytic skills, as a behavior analyst before masters degree, and career pathing towards a BCBA position with the organization after passing the exam. Programs are implemented with client individualization and clinical integrity as a priority. Ability to work in different types of settings (clinic-based, school-based, and some school based) and with different ages, within one organization.
cons: Work can be stressful at times, but things ebb and flow.

job_title: A Former Employee in Newtown, PA
pros: No pros that make Potential stand out amongst the rest.
cons: Poor management of clinical skills of staff thus resulting in poor delivery of services. Management is out of touch and unaware of the everyday happenings of the clinical staff. Clinical management staff is rarely on site. RBTS seem burnt out and unhappy-poor oversight of RBTS. No standards on hiring RBTS.

pros: Commiserate and build relationships with coworkers
cons: Management undervalued all staff and was incredibly rude

review_title: A place to grow and put down roots
pros: Family comes first, opportunities for advancement, collaborative atmosphere, open-door policy with management, lots of training, working with outside experts
cons: Nature of job is stressful at times,

pros:
Great BCBA's 
Communal feel to it
worked for more benefits for FT
very supportive
cons:
Low pay
frequent schedule changes (at times)
high employee turn rate (people leave shortly after hired)

review_title: Excellent organization to work for and overall a great learning experience
job_title: Registered Behavior Technician in Newtown, PA
pros: Lots of opportunity to learn and improve your skills in the field on ABA (and an excellent training program), flexible with scheduling for college students, and a really great staff!
cons: We were sometimes short on staffing.

review_title: A challenging and rewarding place to work
pros: It's been said that "Some people make things happen, some watch what happens and some wonder what has happened." At Potential, we actually make things happen. It's not easy, but when you see the progress clients make over time, it validates the effort and generates greater motivation.
cons: Very demanding (if that's a con) and sometimes long hours.
